comment_body: I would suggest being cautious towards pmon container, when we have an image for this change and everything is working in a sane manner. (submodule update) Autopep8 can sometimes mess up indentation, although i could not catch anything with my naked eyes.
why is this one not merged?

@jleveque  CI failure when update submodule: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/5945
Could you please say how to run [this ](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-platform-daemons/tree/master/sonic-thermalctld/tests)unit-tests manually?
```

=================================== FAILURES ===================================
______________________ test_updater_thermal_check_min_max ______________________

    def test_updater_thermal_check_min_max():
        chassis = MockChassis()
    
        thermal = MockThermal()
        chassis.get_all_thermals().append(thermal)
    
        chassis.set_modular_chassis(True)
        chassis.set_my_slot(1)
        temperature_updater = TemperatureUpdater(SYSLOG_IDENTIFIER, chassis)
    
        temperature_updater.update()
        slot_dict = temperature_updater.chassis_table.get('Thermal 1')
>       assert slot_dict['minimum_temperature'] == str(thermal.get_minimum_recorded())
E       TypeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute '__getitem__'

tests/test_thermalctld.py:341: TypeError
===================== 1 failed, 16 passed in 0.36 seconds ====================
```

@bratashX: You should be able to follow the instructions for sonic-utilities, but reference the thermalctld package instead: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/blob/master/README.md#setting-up-a-buildtest-environment.

> @bratashX: You should be able to follow the instructions for sonic-utilities, but reference the thermalctld package instead: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/blob/master/README.md#setting-up-a-buildtest-environment.

@jleveque , why is this pr not merged?
@lguohan: At the time this PR was submitted, we had a unit test error, so it was delayed until that issue was fixed, and I simply did not get around to merging it.
@mprabhu-nokia, @Junchao-Mellanox: FYI.

Since you've added a library file, xcvrd_utilities.py, I suggest restructuring the xcvrd package, as this file doesn't belong in the `scripts` directory, as that directory is intended for executable scripts. You can model the structure similar to https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/tree/master/sonic_installer, where there is a "main.py" file which is handled as the entrypoint.

```
=================================== FAILURES ===================================
______________________ test_updater_thermal_check_min_max ______________________
    def test_updater_thermal_check_min_max():
        chassis = MockChassis()
    
        thermal = MockThermal()
        chassis.get_all_thermals().append(thermal)

>       assert slot_dict['minimum_temperature'] == str(thermal.get_minimum_recorded())

```

Can you please check? I may need to revert this PR.

EDIT: It appears a fix has been submitted. Can you please review? https://github.com/Azure/sonic-platform-daemons/pull/121

```
plugins: cov-2.6.0
collected 8 items

tests/test_chassisd.py ........                                                                                                                                                        [100%]

----------- coverage: platform linux, python 3.7.3-final-0 -----------
Name               Stmts   Miss  Cover
--------------------------------------
scripts/chassisd     177     64    64%
Coverage HTML written to dir htmlcov
Coverage XML written to file coverage.xml
```
The missing coverage is mainly around the area of:
* init, signal handling of the main loop
* async subscription handling of the config DB. select() handling etc.

However, the functional area has been separated to classes and fully covered.

@liat-grozovik: Can someone from your team please review?

@Staphylo: Can you also review, please?
I think this daemon should only for the chassis system, so how to prevent it from running on a 1U system?

> 
> 
> I think this daemon should only for the chassis system, so how to prevent it from running on a 1U system?

With the current implementation, the process will start but gracefully exit if not running for modular chassis. This is not part of critical processes, so should not affect PMON container. 
Going forward, one option would be for vendors to add skip_chassisd in their pmon_daemon_control.json file for 1 RU SKUs.

@judyjoseph create PR for 201911

> @judyjoseph create PR for 201911

Raised this PR  https://github.com/Azure/sonic-platform-daemons/pull/89

@Junchao-Mellanox: Can we cherry-pick/backport this to 201911? I'd like to store PSU temperature and voltage to the DB in 201911, also.

Actually, I see in 201911 we have DB entries such as the following:

```
root@sonic:/# redis-cli -n 6 hgetall "TEMPERATURE_INFO|PSU-2 Temp"
 1) "temperature"
 2) "28.0"
 3) "high_threshold"
 4) "100.0"
 5) "low_threshold"
 6) "N/A"
 7) "warning_status"
 8) "False"
 9) "critical_high_threshold"
10) "N/A"
11) "critical_low_threshold"
12) "N/A"
13) "timestamp"
14) "20200707 22:33:38"
```

So it appears we already have this info in the State DB in 201911. So this data appears redundant. Can you confirm?

@jleveque for Mellanox platform, we have PSU temperature information in TEMPERATURE_INFO table of state DB. But I am not sure if there is such information for other vendors. So we add some entries to PSU_INFO table.

@Junchao-Mellanox: Thanks for the info. While I would like to see this ported back to 201911, it would involve backporting all the temperature and threshould APIs to the 201911 branch in sonic-platform-common. That would be a lot of work, and we would need to make sure we don't break anything. For now, I say we don't backport this to 201911.
